name: volume-capture-plane
author: Connectome Workbench Developers
description:
Interpolate image from plane through volume.

NOTE: If you want to generate an image with all of the capabilities of the GUI rendering, see -show-scene.

Renders an image of an arbitrary plane through the volume file, with a simple linear grayscale palette.  The parameter <interp> must be one of:

CUBIC
ENCLOSING_VOXEL
TRILINEAR

inputs.name: volume
inputs.description: the volume file to interpolate from

inputs.name: subvolume
inputs.description: the name or number of the subvolume to use

inputs.name: h_dim
inputs.description: width of output image, in pixels

inputs.name: v_dim
inputs.description: height of output image, in pixels

inputs.name: bottom_left_x
inputs.description: x-coordinate of the bottom left of the output image

inputs.name: bottom_left_y
inputs.description: y-coordinate of the bottom left of the output image

inputs.name: bottom_left_z
inputs.description: z-coordinate of the bottom left of the output image

inputs.name: bottom_right_x
inputs.description: x-coordinate of the bottom right of the output image

inputs.name: bottom_right_y
inputs.description: y-coordinate of the bottom right of the output image

inputs.name: bottom_right_z
inputs.description: z-coordinate of the bottom right of the output image

inputs.name: top_left_x
inputs.description: x-coordinate of the top left of the output image

inputs.name: top_left_y
inputs.description: y-coordinate of the top left of the output image

inputs.name: top_left_z
inputs.description: z-coordinate of the top left of the output image
